maml:description.maml:para: Tag an album using a list of user supplied tags.
Tag an album using a list of user supplied tags. This uses the album.addTags method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the album.
Name of the artist.
Tags to apply to this album. This parameter takes a maximum of ten tags.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the album.
Name of the artist.
Tags to apply to this album. This parameter takes a maximum of ten tags.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-LFMAlbumTag -Album Gore -Artist Deftones -Tag Rock

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will add the rock tag to the album Gore by Deftones.

maml:description.maml:para: Tag an artist using a list of user supplied tags.
Tag an artist using a list of user supplied tags. This uses the artist.addTags method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the artist.
Tags to apply to this album. This parameter takes a maximum of ten tags.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the artist.
Tags to apply to this album. This parameter takes a maximum of ten tags.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will add the rock tag to the artist Deftones

maml:description.maml:para: Adds the token and keys to the credential manager.
Takes the API key and shared secret received from Last.fm and adds them to the credential manager. This will also add the session key after it has been requested.

maml:Description.maml:para: API key that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for all API calls.
Session key that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for all authenticated API calls.
Shared secret that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for API calls that need to be signed.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
API key that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for all API calls.
Session key that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for all authenticated API calls.
Shared secret that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for API calls that need to be signed.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $session = Request-LFMToken -ApiKey $ApiKey -SharedSecret $SharedSecret | Request-LFMSession PS C:\> $session | Add-LFMConfiguration

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will take the session key requested from Last.fm and add it to the $session variable. The $session will then be added to the credential manager.
This will take the session key requested from Last.fm and add it to the credential manager using a single piped command.

maml:description.maml:para: Tag a track using a list of user supplied tags.
Tag a track using a list of user supplied tags. This uses the track.addTags method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the track.
Name of the artist.
Name of the tag.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the artist.
Name of the tag.
Name of the track.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-LFMTrackTag -Track Gore -Artist Deftones -Tag Rock

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will add the rock tag to the track Gore by Deftones.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the metadata and tracklist for an album.
Get the metadata and tracklist for an album using the album name or a musicbrainz id. This uses the album.getInfo method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the album.
Name of the artist.
Transform misspelled artist names into correct artist names.

Username for the context of the request. The user tags for this album are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of available charts for this tag, expressed as date ranges which can be sent to the chart services.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This gets the available charts for the tag rock as a date range.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the supplied track and sees if there is a correction to a canonical track.

Gets the supplied track and sees if there is a correction to a canonical track. The results can be pretty inconsistent. This is best used on tracks or artists when trying to correct a name with punctuation or accents. This uses the track.getCorrection method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the track that needs to be corrected.
Name of the artist that needs to be corrected.
Name of the artist that needs to be corrected.
Name of the track that needs to be corrected.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will correct both the track and artist to their correct names as they both should include accents.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of the recent tracks listened to by a user.

Get a list of the recent tracks listened to by a user. Also includes the currently playing track with the now playing attribute if the user is currently listening to a track. This uses the user.getRecentTracks method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Date to start the range.
Date to end the range.
Username for the context of the request. The recent tracks of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the top albums scrobbled by a user.

Get the top albums scrobbled by a user. A time period can be specified. If no time period is specified the overall chart is chosen by default. This uses the user.getTopAlbums method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Username for the context of the request. The top albums of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.
Period over which to get the top albums.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.

Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Period over which to get the top albums.
Username for the context of the request. The top albums of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the top albums scrobbled by the currently authenticated user.
This will get the top albums scrobbled by the currently authenticated user over the last year.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the top artists scrobbled by a user.

Get the top artists scrobbled by a user. A time period can be specified. If no time period is specified the overall chart is chosen by default. This uses the user.getTopArtists method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Username for the context of the request. The top artists of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.
Period over which to get the top artists.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.

Username for the context of the request. The top artists of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the top artists scrobbled by the currently authenticated user.
This will get the top artists scrobbled by the currently authenticated user over the last year.

Get the top tags set by a user. This uses the user.getTopTags method from the Last.fm API.

Username for the context of the request. The top tags of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the top tags set by the currently authenticated user.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the top tracks scrobbled by a user.

Get the top tracks scrobbled by a user. A time period can be specified. If no time period is specified the overall chart is chosen by default. This uses the user.getTopTracks method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Period over which to get the top artists.
Username for the context of the request. The top tracks of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Period over which to get the top artists.
Username for the context of the request. The top tracks of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the top tracks scrobbled by the currently authenticated user.
This will get the top tracks scrobbled by the currently authenticated user over the last year.

maml:description.maml:para: Get all the times a track has been scrobbled by a user.
Get all the times a track has been scrobbled by a user. This uses the user.getTrackScrobbles method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the track.
Name of the artist.
Username for the context of the request. The scrobbled tracks of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Name of the artist.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Name of the track.
Username for the context of the request. The scrobbled tracks of this user are included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get all the times the track Gore by Deftones has been scrobbled by the currently authenticated user.

maml:description.maml:para: Get an album chart for a user.

Get an album chart for a user. A date range can be specified. If no date range is specified the most recent album chart is chosen by default. This uses the user.getWeeklyAlbumChart method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Date to start the range.
Date to end the range.
Username for the context of the request. The album chart of this user is included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.
Date to end the range.
Date to start the range.
Username for the context of the request. The album chart of this user is included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the recent album chart for the currently authenticated user.
This will get the album chart for the currently authenticated user within the specified date range.
This will get the first chart list for the currently authenticated user and send it down the pipeline to get the album chart.

maml:description.maml:para: Get an artist chart for a user.

Get an artist chart for a user. A date range can be specified. If no date range is specified the most recent artist chart is chosen by default. This uses the user.getWeeklyArtistChart method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Date to start the range.
Date to end the range.
Username for the context of the request. The artist chart of this user is included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.
Date to end the range.
Date to start the range.
Username for the context of the request. The artist chart of this user is included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the recent artist chart for the currently authenticated user.
This will get the artist chart for the currently authenticated user within the specified date range.
This will get the first chart list for the currently authenticated user and send it down the pipeline to get the artist chart.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a list of available charts for a user.
Get a list of available charts for a user. These charts are expressed as date ranges that can be sent to the other chart services. This uses the user.getWeeklyChartList method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Username for the context of the request. The chart list of this user is included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user. The API docs say the user field is mandatory but testing shows that it isn't actually required. Will keep implemented for now.

Username for the context of the request. The chart list of this user is included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user. The API docs say the user field is mandatory but testing shows that it isn't actually required. Will keep implemented for now.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the chart lists for the currently authenticated user.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a track chart for a user.

Get a track chart for a user. A date range can be specified. If no date range is specified the most recent track chart is chosen by default. This uses the user.getWeeklyTrackChart method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Date to start the range.
Date to end the range.
Username for the context of the request. The track chart of this user is included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.
Date to end the range.
Date to start the range.
Username for the context of the request. The track chart of this user is included in the response. Providing no user will use the currently authenticated user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the recent track chart for the currently authenticated user.
This will get the track chart for the currently authenticated user within the specified date range.
This will get the first chart list for the currently authenticated user and send it down the pipeline to get the track chart.

maml:description.maml:para: Untag an album using a user supplied tag.
Untag an album using a user supplied tag. This uses the album.removeTag method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the album.
Name of the artist.
Name of the tag.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the album.
Name of the artist.
Name of the tag.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-LFMAlbumTag -Album Gore -Artist Deftones -Tag Rock

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will remove the rock tag from the album Gore by Deftones.

maml:description.maml:para: Untag an artist using a user supplied tag.
Untag an artist using a user supplied tag. This uses the artist.removeTag method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the artist.
Name of the tag.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the artist.
Name of the tag.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will remove the rock tag from the artist Deftones

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the current configuration.
Removes the configuration from the Windows credential manager. This will remove the ApiKey, SharedSecret, and SessionKey from the current session.

maml:Description.maml:para: Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will remove the current configuration.

maml:description.maml:para: Untag an track using a user supplied tag.
Untag an track using a user supplied tag. This uses the track.removeTag method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the track.
Name of the artist.
Name of the tag.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the artist.
Name of the tag.
Name of the track.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Remove-LFMTrackTag -Track Gore -Artist Deftones -Tag Heavy

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will remove the heavy tag from the track Gore by Deftones.

maml:description.maml:para: Request a session key from Last.fm.
Request a session key by sending the API key, shared secret, and the authentication token as arguments to the auth.getSession method call.

maml:Description.maml:para: API key that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for all API calls.
Token used to generate a session key. It is valid for only 60 minutes from the moment it is granted to a user.
Shared secret that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for API calls that need to be signed.
API key that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for all API calls.
Shared secret that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for API calls that need to be signed.
Token used to generate a session key. It is valid for only 60 minutes from the moment it is granted to a user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will request a token and send all three properties down the pipeline to request a session.
This will request a session key after the token has already been requested and stored in a variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Requests a token from Last.fm.
Requests a token by sending the API key and shared secret as arguments to the auth.getToken method call.

maml:Description.maml:para: API key that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for all API calls.
Shared secret that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for API calls that need to be signed.
API key that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for all API calls.
Shared secret that was created on Last.fm for a user and application. This is required for API calls that need to be signed.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will request a token using the API key and shared secret.

maml:description.maml:para: Search for an album by name.
Search for an album by name. The results will be sorted by relevance. This uses the album.search method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the album.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Name of the album.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will search for albums that match Gore.

maml:description.maml:para: Search for an artist by name.
Search for an artist by name. The results will be sorted by relevance. This uses the artist.search method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the artist.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Name of the artist.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will search for artists that match Deftones.

maml:description.maml:para: Search for a track by name.
Search for a track by name. The results will be sorted by relevance. This uses the track.search method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the track.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Limit the number of results per page.
Page number to return. Defaults to the first page.
Name of the track.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will search for tracks that match White Pony.

maml:description.maml:para: Love a track for a user.
Love a track for a user. This uses the track.love method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the artist.
Name of the track.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the artist.
Name of the track.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will love the track Gore by Deftones.

maml:description.maml:para: Notify Last.fm that a user has started listening to a track.
Notify Last.fm that a user has started listening to a track. This uses the track.updateNowPlaying method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the track.
Name of the artist
Name of the album.
Musicbrainz id for the track.
Length of the track in seconds.
Returns an object with info on the track set to now playing.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the album.
Name of the artist
Length of the track in seconds.
Musicbrainz id for the track.
Returns an object with info on the track set to now playing.
Name of the track.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will set the track Gore by Deftones as now playing for the currently authenticated user.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-LFMTrackNowPlaying -Track Passenger -Artist Deftones -Album 'White Pony' -Duration 367 -Id '119c683c-d078-41f3-b63c-cb92816d7329'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will set the track Passenger by Deftones as now playing with more granular information. This is updated for the currently authenticated user.

maml:description.maml:para: Add a track play to the profile of the currently authenticated user.
Add a track play to the profile of the currently authenticated user. This uses the track.scrobble method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the artist.
Name of the track.
Time the track started playing.
Name of the album.
Musicbrainz id for the track.
Number of the track on the album.
Length of the track in seconds.
Returns an object with info on the track set to scrobble.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the album.
Name of the artist.
Length of the track in seconds.
Musicbrainz id for the track.
Returns an object with info on the track set to scrobble.
Time the track started playing.
Name of the track.
Number of the track on the album.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will scrobble the track Gore by Deftones for the currently authenticated user.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-LFMTrackScrobble -Artist Deftones -Track Gore -Timestamp (Get-Date) -Album Gore -TrackNumber 9 -Duration 299

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will scrobble the track Gore by Deftones with more granular information. This is updated for the currently authenticated user.

maml:description.maml:para: Unlove a track for a user.
Unlove a track for a user. This uses the track.unlove method from the Last.fm API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the artist.
Name of the track.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Name of the artist.
Name of the track.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will unlove the track Gore by Deftones.
